item.title: Comment on Froala Editor V4.0.7 — Awesome Improvements For Top Features by Mostafa Yousef
item.dc:creator: Mostafa Yousef
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://froala.com/blog/editor/froala-editor-v4-0-7-awesome-improvements-for-top-features/comment-page-1/#comment-1555">Ainsley</a>.
Hi Ainsley– The download page https://froala.com/wysiwyg-editor/download/ is always updated to the latest version, you can download version 4.0.7 from there. Enjoy Froala!
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Ainsley.

Hi Ainsley– The download page https://froala.com/wysiwyg-editor/download/ is always updated to the latest version, you can download version 4.0.7 from there. Enjoy Froala!

item.title: Comment on Introducing Froala v4.0 —The Next Generation of WYSIWYG Editing by Pleun V
item.dc:creator: Pleun V
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://froala.com/blog/general/introducing-froala-v4-0-the-next-generation-of-wysiwyg-editing/comment-page-1/#comment-1145">Ronald Stevens</a>.
Markdown not a hot item? It's 2021, the times where style & layout were embedded inside of the text have mostly faded away. Markdown is a no-brainer for anything that needs a separation between layout & content, which these days is pretty much every website. Not to mention advanced markup capabilities like code syntax, formulas etc, which granted, is slightly more niche (but more prevalent than you'd think).
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Ronald Stevens.

Markdown not a hot item? It’s 2021, the times where style & layout were embedded inside of the text have mostly faded away. Markdown is a no-brainer for anything that needs a separation between layout & content, which these days is pretty much every website. Not to mention advanced markup capabilities like code syntax, formulas etc, which granted, is slightly more niche (but more prevalent than you’d think).

item.title: Comment on Introducing Froala v4.0 —The Next Generation of WYSIWYG Editing by Ronald Stevens
item.dc:creator: Ronald Stevens
item.description:
Markdown support is nice for all the geeks out there that like this feature, but ask yourself, how many are out there? I am very commercial and blunt. And I think this feature is not really a hot item. The tracking is cute as long as it can be take out and does not add a lot of overhead. Otherwise....?
I love your editor, do not get me wrong, I bought it because I think it deserves a spot in my app.
item.content:encoded:
Markdown support is nice for all the geeks out there that like this feature, but ask yourself, how many are out there? I am very commercial and blunt. And I think this feature is not really a hot item. The tracking is cute as long as it can be take out and does not add a lot of overhead. Otherwise….?

I love your editor, do not get me wrong, I bought it because I think it deserves a spot in my app.

item.title: Comment on Froala Editor 3.3 Sneak Preview by Kirti Joshi
item.dc:creator: Kirti Joshi
item.description:
In reply to <a href="https://froala.com/blog/editor/froala-editor-3-3-sneak-preview/comment-page-1/#comment-658">James Serpe</a>.
Hi! We are excited to get the new markdown and tracking features out to everyone very soon! Our product team is working actively on the final release of 3.3 and it and shouldn't take much longer. Stay tuned for the release announcement.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to James Serpe.

Hi! We are excited to get the new markdown and tracking features out to everyone very soon! Our product team is working actively on the final release of 3.3 and it and shouldn’t take much longer. Stay tuned for the release announcement.
